## Description {#details}

This node is the base class for sequential/in-order min/max selections.

Note that their fundamental difference from <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevminmaxexpr">SCEVMinMaxExpr</a>&#39;s is that they are early-returning upon reaching saturation point. I.e. given <code>0 umin&#95;seq poison</code>, the result will be <code>0</code>, while the result of <code>0 umin poison</code> is <code>poison</code>. When returning early, later expressions are not executed, so <code>0 umin&#95;seq (x u/ 0)</code> does not result in undefined behavior.

Definition at line 517 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/scalarevolutionexpressions-h">ScalarEvolutionExpressions.h</a>.
